title: General Factoring Procedure
text: When given a trinomial in the form $$x^2+bx+c$$, we must find two numbers (m and n) that multiply to c and add to $$b$$. The factored solution is $$\left(x+m\right) \left(x+n\right)$$.
speech: When given a trinomial in the form  x squared plus b x plus c , we must find two numbers (m and n) that multiply to c and add to  b . The factored solution is  parentheses x plus m,  times, parentheses x plus n,  .
pacedSpeech: When given a trinomial in the form   x squared plus b x plus c
, we must find two numbers (m and n) that multiply to c and add to   b
. The factored solution is    x plus m,  times,  x plus n,

title: Rearranging our Trinomial
text: We must rearrange our trinomial to fix the form $$x^2+bx+c$$. We get $$x^2+5x-6$$.
speech: We must rearrange our trinomial to fix the form  x squared plus b x plus c . We get  x squared, plus 5 x minus 6 .
pacedSpeech: We must rearrange our trinomial to fix the form   x squared plus b x plus c
. We get   x squared, plus 5 x minus 6

title: Finding $$m$$ and $$n$$
text: $$c=-6$$, and $$b=5$$. $$m=6$$ and $$m=-1$$ multiply to c and add to $$b$$. So, our solution is $$\left(x+6\right) \left(x-1\right)$$.
speech: c is equal to, negative 6 , and  b, is equal to 5 .  m, is equal to 6  and  m, is equal to negative 1  multiply to c and add to  b . So, our solution is  parentheses x plus 6,  times, parentheses x minus 1,  .

multiply to c and add to   b
. So, our solution is    x plus 6,  times,  x minus 1,
